item.title: Regular Expressions in Python
item.description: Hello! This semester I’ve been taking a class in which I’ve learned a little bit of Python, and I’d like to share some of what I learned, particularly regular expressions! Regular expressions are a sequence of characters that allow you to find matches in text. import re x="abc aac ac acb bac 1a6" re.findall(r"a.",x) ## ['ab', 'aa', 'ac', 'ac', 'ac', 'a6'] In the code above “a.” returns “a” and any character that follows the “a”.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have been working on: Hate Crime Trends and Political Party Affiliation Risk Factor Correlation with Heart Disease

item.title: Hate Crime Trends and Political Party Affiliation
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:
